Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for hosting workloads on Azure Dedicated Host, including compute capacity, storage needs, and compliance requirements.
Design the architecture for Azure Dedicated Host, including host group placement, VM sizing, and workload distribution.
Obtain necessary approvals and authorizations for provisioning Azure Dedicated Host, including budget and compliance checks.
Create and configure Azure Dedicated Host in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure proper host group configuration for workload isolation.
Set up host groups to organize and manage Azure Dedicated Hosts effectively. Define placement policies and ensure proper grouping for workloads.
Apply security best practices, including encryption for data at rest and in transit, access control policies, and integration with Azure Security Center.
Deploy VMs on Azure Dedicated Host, ensuring proper sizing and configuration for workloads. Validate VM compatibility with the host.
Set up monitoring and alerting for Azure Dedicated Host using Azure Monitor and Log Analytics. Configure alerts for host health, VM performance, and resource utilization.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Azure Dedicated Hosts. Set up alerts for any anomalies or potential issues.
Perform thorough testing of workloads hosted on Azure Dedicated Host, including stress tests, failover scenarios, and performance benchmarks.
Document the configuration of Azure Dedicated Host, including host groups, VM placements, and security settings. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Maintain up-to-date documentation for Azure Dedicated Hosts, including operational procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting guides.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Regularly audit the configurations of Azure Dedicated Hosts to ensure they align with organizational policies and compliance requirements.
Establish operational support processes for managing Azure Dedicated Host, including incident response, troubleshooting, and maintenance.
Ensure that all security updates and patches are applied to the Azure Dedicated Hosts to maintain compliance and protect against vulnerabilities.
Analyze the utilization of Azure Dedicated Hosts to ensure optimal resource usage. Identify underutilized or overutilized hosts and take corrective actions.
Conduct failover tests to ensure workloads can be seamlessly moved to other hosts in case of hardware failure or maintenance.
Backup metadata and configuration details of Azure Dedicated Hosts to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Provide regular training to the operations team on managing Azure Dedicated Hosts, including new features, best practices, and troubleshooting techniques.
Ensure that Azure Dedicated Hosts meet the agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and address any deviations promptly.
Periodically review and optimize the placement of workloads on Azure Dedicated Hosts to ensure efficient resource utilization and cost-effectiveness.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential issues with Azure Dedicated Hosts. Ensure familiarity with escalation procedures.
Review the cost associated with Azure Dedicated Hosts and identify opportunities for cost savings without compromising performance or compliance.
